page.title: 03Soil Types And Climate
page.content: There are two main{soil groups}in this area,both of glacial origin.{Podsols, derived from fluvioglacial outwash, tend to be on the lowest land and near to Loch Leven.Being derived from sands and gravels,these are more leached but also more easily worked than the{Brown {Forest}soils.These are derived from till and have greater clay content. {Till}forms low elevations such as Gallowhill(1003) and much of the west of the Kinross Basin.{Fluvioglacial sediments contain more sandstone, which lies eastwards from the lavas. {Alluvial}soils lie along shallow valleys. Like much of the higher parts of Central Scotland's lowland(around 150m),the Kinross Basin has moderate {climatic constraints}upon farming. Under the warm day climatic conditions the soils,generally of red-brown sandy
